snippet: The Labor Department needs to update the salary threshold so an additional 6.1 million salaried workers could become eligible for overtime.
abstract: Editorial charges that salaried workers are vulnerable to exploitation under current labor laws, as they are not eligible for overtime pay mandated for hourly wage jobs; submits raising salary threshold that defines white-collar salary, which has been stagnant since 1975, would do much to address problem; refutes arguments that raising salary threshold will harm young professionals.
lead_paragraph: The Labor Department needs to update the salary threshold so an additional 6.1 million salaried workers could become eligible for overtime.
